questions.question: Which tab in MS Word is primarily used for adding a Table of Contents, Footnotes, and Citations?
questions.explanation: The References tab contains all the tools needed for academic and professional document structuring like TOC and citations.

questions.question: What is the key requirement for generating an Automatic Table of Contents in Word?
options: You must apply Heading Styles (Heading 1, 2, etc.) to your titles
You must insert a table first
questions.explanation: The Automatic Table of Contents feature looks for text formatted with Heading styles (Heading 1, 2, 3) to build the list.

questions.question: Where does a 'Footnote' appear by default?
options: At the very end of the document
At the bottom of the page where the reference is marked
questions.explanation: Footnotes appear at the bottom (foot) of the specific page where the note number is inserted.

questions.question: Google Lens is an AI tool that allows you to:
options: Search what you see, translate text in images, and identify plants
questions.explanation: Google Lens uses image recognition AI to analyze photos or live camera feeds for information, translation, and shopping.

questions.question: What is a 'Bibliography'?
options: A list of all sources (books, websites) cited in the document
questions.explanation: A Bibliography (or Works Cited) is a comprehensive list of the sources used to write the document.

questions.question: Which feature would you use to label an image as 'Figure 1' or a table as 'Table 1'?
questions.explanation: The 'Insert Caption' command is used to add numbered labels to figures, tables, and equations.

questions.question: If you add a new chapter to your document, how do you reflect this change in the Table of Contents?
options: Delete the TOC and create a new one
Click 'Update Table' and choose 'Update entire table'
questions.explanation: The 'Update Table' button refreshes the TOC to include any new headings or page number changes.

questions.question: What is the difference between a Footnote and an Endnote?
options: Footnotes are red, Endnotes are blue
Footnotes appear at the bottom of the page; Endnotes appear at the end of the document/section
Endnotes are for legal documents only
questions.explanation: The main difference is placement: Footnotes are page-specific, while Endnotes collect all notes at the end of the work.

questions.question: The 'Table of Authorities' is primarily used in which type of documents?
questions.explanation: A Table of Authorities is used in legal briefs to list cases, statutes, and other authorities cited in the document.

questions.question: To create an Index (list of keywords with page numbers) at the end of a book, what must you do first?
questions.explanation: You must first 'Mark Entry' for the specific words you want to appear in the Index.

questions.question: Which of the following is a common citation style available in MS Word?
questions.explanation: APA, MLA, and Chicago are standard academic citation styles supported by MS Word.

questions.question: In the context of Research, what does the 'Smart Lookup' feature do?
options: Searches the web for definitions, images, and other information about selected text
questions.explanation: Smart Lookup uses Bing to find web results and definitions for the text you select within the document.

questions.question: How can Google Drive with AI integration help you find a specific receipt photo?
options: By remembering the file name only
By searching for text that appears inside the image (e.g., 'coffee')
questions.explanation: Google Drive's AI (OCR) can recognize text within images and PDFs, allowing you to search for files based on their content.

questions.question: What is a 'Cross-reference'?
options: A link that refers the reader to another location in the same document (e.g., 'See Figure 3')
questions.explanation: Cross-references are internal links that direct readers to related items like headings, figures, or footnotes within the same file.

questions.question: The 'Insert Citation' button helps you to:
options: Credit a source of information inline with your text
questions.explanation: Citations are used to acknowledge the source of a quote or idea right where it appears in the text.

questions.question: If you want to view all the footnotes in your document, you can use the _____ button.
questions.explanation: The 'Show Notes' button jumps to the footnote or endnote area so you can read or edit them.

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a group in the References Tab?
questions.explanation: Slideshow is a tab in PowerPoint, not a group in the MS Word References tab.

questions.question: You can use Google Lens to translate text from a menu in a foreign language by:
options: Pointing your camera at the menu and selecting the Translate filter
questions.explanation: Google Lens has a specific 'Translate' filter that overlays the translation on the live camera view.

questions.question: When you insert a Caption for a table, where is it usually placed?
questions.explanation: Captions are standardly placed either immediately above or below the object they describe.

questions.question: Which tool allows you to manage all the sources you have cited in a document (edit, delete, copy)?
questions.explanation: The 'Manage Sources' command opens a manager where you can add, edit, or delete sources for your current and master lists.
